newsitem.title: FINLAND: GYLLENBERG SAYS SEEKS BANKING LICENSE.
newsitem.headline: GYLLENBERG SAYS SEEKS BANKING LICENSE.

text.p: Finnish securities house Ane Gyllenberg Oy said in a statement on Wednesday it plans to set up a bank to strengthen its asset management services.
"The request for a license for Gyllenberg Private Bank will be issued to the Finance Ministry at the latest by the start of 1997," the company said.
The bank's core products will be avista accounts and fixed term deposits, and its assets will be invested mainly in low-risk interest rate instruments, Gyllenberg said.
"Gyllenberg Private Bank will not start large scale lending," it added.
The bank will operate as a fully owned subsidiary of Ane Gyllenberg Oy with a 41 million markka share capital, it said.
